title: Mortgage and refinance interest rates today, December 6, 2025: Inflation data pushes rates higher
description: These are today's mortgage and refinance rates. Interest rates are up today, but they're still down by over a half-point since January. Lock in your rate today.

title: Who is Kevin Hassett? The rumored Fed pick says inflation is ‘way down,’ sees ‘political bias’ in jobs data, and suggested firing Powell over a renovation
description: “If you’d asked me a year ago, I would have said I think Kevin would be a good pick. I wouldn’t say that today. Kevin has been incredibly dishonest.”

title: Nigeria’s Cardoso Opens Door to Resuming Rate Cuts in 2026
description: Nigerian central bank Governor Olayemi Cardoso hinted that policymakers could resume interest-rate cuts next year, provided inflation continues to cool as expected.

title: Shoppers brace for a tighter holiday season as gift prices keep climbing: BofA survey
description: Who's sliding down the chimney this year? Budget-conscious shoppers wonder if it'll be Santa with gifts — or the Grinch bringing the inflation pinch.

title: Core inflation in Japan’s capital brings BOJ closer to a rate hike
‘It didn’t have to be this way’ — Top economist warns affordability crisis will continue as tariffs and immigration crackdown send inflation higher
description: "Consumer price inflation is near 3%, well above the Fed’s inflation target, and everything points to even higher inflation dead-ahead."

title: Where people are — and are not — shopping right now
description: As inflation and layoffs bite, Americans are trading splurges for savings, turning to T.J. Maxx, Ross, and Walmart for value.

title: Swiss Inflation to Pick Up in Coming Months, SNB’s Schlegel Says
description: Consumer-price growth in Switzerland is expected to accelerate a bit, according to Swiss National Bank President Martin Schlegel.

title: ECB’s Muller Sees Inflation Near 2% for Foreseeable Future
description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Madis Muller suggested he’s relaxed about euro-area price pressures and indicated little appetite for further interest-rate action.
